Improvements.Improvement: Use constants for repeated String literals
Improvements.Description: It's a good practice to define constants for String literals that are used multiple times. It makes the code easier to maintain and less error-prone.
Meaningful variable names make code easier to read and understand. For example, `tx` could be renamed to `transaction` and `s` to `role`.
The method is quite long. Consider breaking it up into smaller methods to improve readability and maintainability.
